entry.title: UniFi Switch 6.5.32
entry.summary:
Improvements
Update the boot animation logo for USW-Pro, USW-Enterprise and USW-PoE, USW-MC, USP-RPS, and USP-PDU-Pro models. [USW-Flex] Add support for "Cycle PoE Power" during restarts. [USW-Flex-XG] Improve compatibility with particular client NICs. [USW-Pro] Filter out invalid temperature sensor readings.
Bugfixes
Fix incorrect requested RPS power on USW-Pro-Aggregation and USW-Enterprise-24-PoE. Fix incorrect RPS power warning on the LCM when AC power is recovered. [USW-Flex-XG] Fix the issue that resulted in packet loss and unstable network connectivity. [USW-Enterprise-8-PoE] Fix device going offline due to tons of oops files. [USW-Enterprise-8-PoE] Fix client MAC address in the whitelist cannot get access to the internet when connecting to other ports on the switch.
Additional information
Your device built-in display may turn black or unresponsive for ~10 minutes after firmware upgrades to upgrade LCM firmware. Update your devices by changing the Device Firmware Release Channel in the UniFi Network application to Release Candidate. If you wish to go back to the Official release after the upgrade, change the release channel back to Official.
If you encounter any issues with this release, please provide us some details on your setup and include the below information:
Switch model(s) Previous Switch release version UniFi Network application version

entry.title: UniFi Access Point 6.5.33
entry.summary:
Overview UniFi Access Point 6.5.33 addresses issues with meshing while also improving the channel selection after an RF Scan. This release is currently a Release Candidate for the Generation 2/3/4/6 models. Improvements
Automatically pick the best channel after an RF Scan if the AP Radio Channel is set to Auto. Speed up the meshing reconnection after the uplink goes through a provision/reboot/firmware update.
Bugfixes
Fix wired APs occasionally meshing with each other instead of relying on wired uplinks when SFP connections are used between switches. [Gen2/Gen3/Gen6 models] Fix WiFi not broadcasting after boot intermittently. [Gen4 models] Fix 5GHz WiFi disappearing occasionally after a DFS radar hit when broadcasting at 160MHz. [Gen6 models] Fix kernel crash to improve overall stability. [Gen6 models] Fix incorrect channel width being applied occasionally.
Additional information
Refer to the Help Center article here to determine the UniFi Access Point generation. Update your devices by changing the Device Firmware Release Channel in the UniFi Network application to Release Candidate. If you wish to go back to the Official release after the upgrade, change the release channel back to Official.
If you encounter any issues with this release, please provide us some details on your setup and include the below information:
AP model(s) Previous AP release version UniFi Network application version

entry.title: UniFi Access Point 6.5.28
entry.summary:
Overview * This release is currently stable/official for the following models, it's still an RC for all other models:
AC-Lite/LR/Pro/M/M-PRO/IW AC-HD/SHD/XG/BaseStationXG IW-HD U6-Pro/Mesh/IW/Extender/Enterprise/Enterprise-IW
* Please also review the 6.5.26 (RC) changes here. Improvements
[UAP] Improve RF Scan accuracy for channel widths greater than 20MHz.
Bugfixes
[UAP] Fix radios selecting overlapping 2.4GHz channels after an RF scan. [UAP] Fix device config application occasionally taking longer than usual. [UAP-Gen2/Gen3/Gen6] Fix WPA3 fast roaming not working intermittently.
Additional information
Please refer to this article to find more details on how to identify your Access Point generation. Instead of using the manual links, you can also configure the Device Firmware Release Channel in the Network Application.
All feedback is welcome, including lettings us know about successful device upgrades. Please ensure that you include the following information at a minimum:
Network Application version. Firmware version (previous and current). Device model(s).
